title: Why do people get so salty over Yasuo
body:
Play him for yourself and learn his weaknesses in addition to his strengths

I used to struggle against that champion, but after I learned him and got good, I no longer have a problem with him when I play other champions :D

replies.body: My only real vendetta against him is that wall. When you play champs that don't possess anything that isn't a "projectile", it starts to piss you off after a while. Otherwise the rest is _bearable_.
His wall is a 25 second cooldown and he maxes it last. Easy to bait out with one of your abilities...
exactly make it like braums. block one projectile and then reduced damage from the rest.
They aren't complaining because they can't play against him. They're complaining because they don't want to. He's not fun to deal with.

> [{quoted}](name=Troy242621,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=z8IyHxU4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-31T15:06:25.053+0000)
>
> They aren't complaining because they can't play against him. They're complaining because they don't want to. He's not fun to deal with.

This basically.  You can zone him out and deny him early game, and he will still come back and destroy your team later.
So like a nasus? Late game scaling isn't allowed?
That's a powerspike, not scaling.
Yasuo becomes strong with PD/IE but he doesn't scale solely with them. Build only those 2 items and see how lackluster your damage is when tanks start stacking armor
I thoughth power spikes was where a certain champion excels for a bit, like taking a drug, it lasts for a short but eventually it fades away. Thanks for informing me.

> [{quoted}](name=Troy242621,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=z8IyHxU4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-07-31T15:06:25.053+0000)
>
> They aren't complaining because they can't play against him. They're complaining because they don't want to. He's not fun to deal with.

How? I can play fucking Urgot and take a shit on a Yasuo.

Because Urgot counters Yas I think.

Play some other champs against him.

Here's the thing about that though. 

I'm currently lvl 3 on Yasuo mastery and let me make this clear, I am terrible God aweful garbage at him. He's frankly the farthest thing there is from my play style. 
And because I'm so bad at him mechanically I mess up basic things, which gets punished instead of his actual weaknesses, meaning after about 20 Yasuo games I still have no clue what most of his weaknesses are.

Bruisers with no projectiles are his only real weakness. Not saying he's OP, in fact I think he is bad and loses a lot of games. The problem is that his laning is insanely strong and oppressive while his teamfighting is trash. It means playing Yasuo just ruins the fun for enemies without actually helping your team win.
His weakness is the insane skill requirement. One mess up during E and you're done.
Besides, even if his only weakness is his skill cap how are you supposed to punish that?

You beat him by playing better, not rely on some magical cheese that miracly make you stronger despite lack of skill.

But since you want that anyway {{champion:122}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:86}}
That's not at all what I'm looking for.  I'm talking about things like Katarina's weak laneing or Azirs power drop before he gets a second item. Counters and weaknesses are two diffrent things.

Because:

- High mobility
- Decent CC
- 60% crit. rate with just 1 item. His passive also grants him a shield, making him somewhat tanky.
- A wall which blocks every projectile coming from ANY direction for 3.75 seconds.
- Low cooldown and game-breaking ultimate.

Yasuo is broken. That's all.
Not broken just frustrating theres a difference
{{champion:105}} {{champion:223}} apparently not
He said they were different, not mutually exclusive.
He's pretty broken though, I've seen way too many tank Yasuo's deal tons of damage while being difficult to kill.

LUL silver 5 saying that yasuo is broken just because he lists his kit

maokai:

* good uninterruptable mobility with w
* high damage with %max hp damage
* strong aoe ultimate that reduces damage allies take
* strong innate sustain
* high cc with w and q

In terms of pro-speaking, Diamond V is nothing. This game starts to being serious shit at Diamond II. Sure, probably he is better than me at mechanics and better than me overall, but he shouldn't treat me with such prepotence and arrogance.

yet they have nerfed mao since s5 . made his passive weaker so he is weaker during laning phase. mao is still an immobile tank. mao has cool downs and can be a mana hungry champ. they also nerfed the cd on his Q. where is the nerf on yasou's dash that he can use every .5 secs with no mana cost? his tornado goes through creeps and knock you up so you cant be protected by creeps. he can gap close from half a lane away. also mao received indirect nerfs by rework of ap items. ROA isnt as good as it use to be it gives less hp. I will admit the passive on catalyst is nice in lane. mao also dont snowball like yasou. mao is a slow scaling late game hyper tank. he is weak early and needs at least {{item:3025}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3068}} to be a real threat in game. where as yasou just needs {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} and then he can pretty much 1 vs 1 any one. where as other champs that require those same two crit items dont. IE: {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:18}} even as an MARKSMAN who is crit reliant those items dont alone scale you into late game. yasou can also go 12-0-18 masteries with tons of def stats and build off tank ad bruiser and still win. {{item:3087}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3155}}
Jax and irelia stack even more tanky stats than top lane and still shred your hp. If Yas what that good at scaling why are lcs teams using jax/irelia and not yas?

difference being is PRO play aka LCS is teams are super coordinated as where in solo Q or selfish Q people are more about the me me me and dont coordinate as well and focus on taking out one single champ in a fight. we are talking solo q, normal games, not pro play. if you wanna talk pro play there are alot of champs that arent pick or viable for #s of reasons. such as a draven at adc, everyone a draven can 1 vs 1 any one and has one of the highest damage outputs in the game, but in pro play in a team fight situation where draven is required to catch axes to maximize his damage it is too easy to project where he will be position wise and to easy to focus with cc. also take sivir for example always a viable PRO pick even though she isnt good vs most adcs in  a 2 vs 2 lane. they pick her for the utility in her kit (ult) and for the wave clear aoe damage and typically will force a lane swap to make sure she isnt punished early. so we arent comparing apples to apples, we are comparing apples to grapefruit, yes they are both fruits but not the same. but if we are all as good as pro players then non of us would bitch that yasou is broken or that cait is op and her traps need nerfs. but we are the other 99% and we arent as good, we dont spend 100hrs aweek playing this game and ever variable of the game.or at least i hope not , for me i work 48hours a week if not 56 on some weeks, i dont have that time, i have a life.

That doesn't answer my question at all. Jax and irelia are both selfish/ risky melee carries like yasuo. What utility does jax and irelia have? If you think about it Yasuo has even more utility than them with the windwall and aoe knockup lockdown. Its obvious that team coordination has nothing to do with these 2 champs being played as they lack stuff to help the team and are basically just beatsticks like yas. You cant coordinate your teamfight around a irelia stun/engage like you can a sivir. The pros obviously know something you don't or yasuo would certainly be played in lcs over irelia and jax.
because he's a whopping zero fun to play against.
I feel like he's one of those champs that, no matter how good you become at outplaying him, he's just gonna be frustrating af to play against. He's just inherently obnoxious with his kit.
I get salty because he uses MY minions to abuse me. As if minion block wasn't enough.....
If you say you have no problem facing a yasuo, you haven't faced a good yasuo.

Yasuo isn't an overpowered champion, his kit just makes it so that he essentially turns League into a one-player game. 

You can't "outplay" Yasuo, you can only wait for or hope for him to outplay himself.

> Play him for yourself and learn his weaknesses in addition to his strengths

I used to struggle against that champion, but after I learned him and got good, I no longer have a problem with him when I play other champions :D

I did, and I even maxed Q instead of E, and STILL went 12/2 and carried the heck out of the game. Almost no idea what I was doing, just spam E and it was ridiculously easy. Opponent couldnn't keep up with the bs mobility.

{{champion:254}} {{champion:54}} passive that gives a shield after a period of time

{{champion:157}}  passive that gives him a shield after a period of time (charges by walking)  and double crit chance (-10% ad)

I feel as if Yasuo's passive should be split , only giving him the double crit chance. I'm not saying his shield is broken or anything like that. I just hate the fact that after he uses wind wall he still has that shield to fall back on. It makes trading with champions like {{champion:103}} fairly difficult (yet not impossible). And yes, I understand I can break the shield with a auto attack, but that normally leads to him dashing into me and unleashing a full combo.

I have played Yasuo, I understand that he isn't the easiest champion. He isn't over-powered, JUST THE MOST PAINFUL CHAMPION TO PLAY AGAINST in my opinion.

I have some time on Yasuo and can say one thing:

A good Yasuo has no excuse to ever have a negative KDA unless he was outright counterpicked by the enemy team. Once you learn how to utilize monsters in the Jungle for your dash, global positioning, and have at least some coordination with your team, all you need is gold to become an absolute monster middle and late game.
I don't like the sounds he makesâ€¦ that's it. That slashing, HASAGI, tornado sounds, all of it

I've figured him out a good while ago, but every time I'm against him top lane I swear. His laning is just so soul crushingly aggravating that even when I'm playing a champ with no projectiles he can just keep going and going and going and going to chip me out anyways. 

Also that PD bruiser build... asdfafdsafasfgazfdaf
I don't wanna play counter picks every game just so I can deal with Yasuo...

Just play,

I actually really enjoy playing against Yasuo in lane. I think that he's manageable for the most part.

However, if he's surrounded by teammates who all synergize with his ult, he becomes an absolute pain in the ass to deal with.

Making this thread is like when I made the same threads for Zed: When you get bodied by Yasuo, it's just feels so much worse than when you get bodied by someone with a higher chance of bodying *your whole team*. Hecarim? Ashe? Malzahar? Nah, ban Zed, LB, and Yasuo. The REAL CANCERS! AMIRIGHT OR AREYOUWRONG!?
